content.raw:
Can you clarify a few things for me so I know the expected behaviour? And maybe you can update the documentation to make it clearer according to the answers...

1. Static means the camera position is fixed. Would it then just follow the model by changing its orientation?

1. Is xyz only used if static is true, and distance only used if static is set to false?

1. What happens if both relative and static are true? The initial position is expressed in the model frame but when the model moves the camera stays attached to the world (and the distance between camera and model changes)?
